filter.description: Indicates the availability of the vaccine in the United States.
If 'true', this is not a product that is not a vaccine.

property.description: Instructions on usage or other relevant notes.
Indicates the availability of the vaccine in the United States.
If 'true', this is not a product that is not a vaccine.
Indicates the last time this particular vaccine code was updated.

property.valueString: This CVX code allows reporting of a vaccination when formulation is unknown (for example, when recording a adenovirus vaccination when noted on a vaccination card)
Applies to dengue tetravalent product (e.g. DENGVAXIA)

concept.display: diphtheria and tetanus toxoids, adsorbed for pediatric use
diphtheria, tetanus toxoids and acellular pertussis vaccine
diphtheria, tetanus toxoids and acellular pertussis vaccine, 5 pertussis antigens
diphtheria, tetanus toxoids and acellular pertussis vaccine, unspecified formulation

property.valueString: This CVX code allows reporting of a vaccination when formulation is unknown (for example, when recording a DTaP vaccination when noted on a vaccination card)

concept.display: DTaP-Haemophilus influenzae type b conjugate vaccine
diphtheria, tetanus toxoids and acellular pertussis vaccine, Haemophilus influenzae type b conjugate, and poliovirus vaccine, inactivated (DTaP-Hib-IPV)
Diphtheria, tetanus toxoids and acellular pertussis vaccine, and poliovirus vaccine, inactivated
diphtheria, tetanus toxoids and pertussis vaccine
DTP-Haemophilus influenzae type b conjugate vaccine
DTP- Haemophilus influenzae type b conjugate and hepatitis b vaccine

property.valueString: This CVX has been corrected. This non-US vaccine contained DTP, Hib and Hep B. It was withdrawn in 2007 .

concept.display: hepatitis A vaccine, pediatric/adolescent dosage, 2 dose schedule
hepatitis A vaccine, pediatric/adolescent dosage, 3 dose schedule

property.valueString: This vaccine formulation is inactive and should not be used, except to record historic vaccinations with this formulation.

concept.display: hepatitis A vaccine, pediatric dosage, unspecified formulation

property.valueString: Do NOT use this code.  If formulation is unknown, use CVX 85.  There is only one formulation of Hep A, peds.
This CVX code allows reporting of a vaccination when formulation is unknown (for example, when recording a HepA vaccination when noted on a vaccination card)

concept.display: hepatitis A and hepatitis B vaccine
hepatitis B vaccine, pediatric or pediatric/adolescent dosage

property.valueString: This code applies to any standard pediatric formulation of Hepatitis B vaccine. It should not be used for the 2-dose hepatitis B schedule for adolescents (11-15 year olds). It requires Merck's Recombivax HB adult formulation. Use code 43 for that vaccine.

concept.display: hepatitis B vaccine, adolescent/high risk infant dosage

property.valueString: As of August 27, 1998, Merck ceased distribution of their adolescent/high risk infant hepatitis B vaccine dosage. Code 42 should only be used to record historical records. For current administration of hepatitis B vaccine, pediatric/adolescent dosage, use code 08.

As of September 1999, a 2-dose hepatitis B schedule for adolescents (11-15 year olds) was FDA approved for Merck's Recombivax HB adult formulation. Use code 43 for the 2-dose. This code should be used for any use of standard adult formulation of hepatitis B vaccine.

concept.display: hepatitis B vaccine, dialysis patient dosage

property.valueString: NDCs that are used for both vaccine and dialysis (e.g. Engerix-B)  are mapped to CVX 43 which is not specific to dialysis use
This CVX code allows reporting of a vaccination when formulation is unknown (for example, when recording a HepB vaccination when noted on a vaccination card)

concept.display: Haemophilus influenzae type b vaccine, PRP-D conjugate
Haemophilus influenzae type b vaccine, HbOC conjugate
Haemophilus influenzae type b vaccine, PRP-T conjugate
Haemophilus influenzae type b vaccine, PRP-OMP conjugate
Haemophilus influenzae type b vaccine, conjugate unspecified formulation
Haemophilus influenzae type b conjugate and Hepatitis B vaccine

property.valueString: This vaccine may still be in use until the existing lots expire on 8/19/16.

concept.display: influenza virus vaccine, live, attenuated, for intranasal use

property.valueString: LAIV3

concept.display: influenza virus vaccine, split virus (incl. purified surface antigen)-retired CODE

property.valueString: This code is being retired. It will still be found in older immunization records. It included both preservative free and non-preservative free.
This CVX code allows reporting of a vaccination when formulation is unknown (for example, when recording a Influenza vaccination when noted on a vaccination card)

concept.display: influenza virus vaccine, H5N1, A/Vietnam/1203/2004 (national stockpile)

property.valueString: This is the OPV that was used in the US
This CVX code allows reporting of a vaccination when formulation is unknown (for example, when recording a polio vaccination when noted on a vaccination card)

concept.display: measles, mumps and rubella virus vaccine
measles, mumps, rubella, and varicella virus vaccine
meningococcal polysaccharide (groups A, C, Y and W-135) diphtheria toxoid conjugate vaccine (MCV4P)

property.valueString: This CVX is intended for use when one of the meningococcal vaccines containing serogroups A, C, W and Y (conjugate or polysaccaride) was given and the exact formulation was not recorded. It should not be used to record newly administered immunizations. It is not to be used when one of the meningococcal vaccines containing other serogroups was administered.
This CVX code allows reporting of a vaccination when formulation is unknown (for example, when recording a pneumococcal vaccination when noted on a vaccination card)

concept.display: rabies vaccine, for intramuscular injection RETIRED CODE

property.valueString: This CVX code has been retired. It is replace by CVX 175,  or CVX 176. It will continue to be found in historic records.
This CVX code allows reporting of a vaccination when formulation is unknown (for example, when recording a rabies vaccination when noted on a vaccination card)

respiratory syncytial virus monoclonal antibody (palivizumab), intramuscular
tetanus and diphtheria toxoids, adsorbed, preservative free, for adult use (5 Lf of tetanus toxoid and 2 Lf of diphtheria toxoid)

designation.value: Td (adult), 2 Lf tetanus toxoid, preservative free, adsorbed

property.valueString: TB Skin test is not vaccine.

property.valueString: TB Skin test is not vaccine.
TB Skin test is not vaccine.
This CVX code allows reporting of a vaccination when formulation is unknown (for example, when recording a typhoid vaccination when noted on a vaccination card)

concept.display: typhoid vaccine, parenteral, other than acetone-killed, dried
typhoid vaccine, parenteral, acetone-killed, dried (U.S. military)
Venezuelan equine encephalitis vaccine, unspecified formulation

property.valueString: This CVX code allows reporting of a vaccination when formulation is unknown (for example, when recording a VEE vaccination when noted on a vaccination card)

concept.display: varicella zoster immune globulin (Investigational New Drug)

property.valueString: This is the YF vaccine that has been available in the US for years. It is stabilized with sorbitol and gelatin.

Code 998 was added for use in VXU HL7 messages where the OBX segment is nested with the RXA segment, but the message does not contain information about a vaccine administration. An example of this use is to report the vaccines due next for a patient when no vaccine administration is being reported.
This CVX code has little utility and should rarely be used.
Code 99 will not be used in this table to avoid confusion with code 999.

concept.display: Japanese Encephalitis vaccine for intramuscular administration

property.valueString: This CVX code allows reporting of a vaccination when formulation is unknown (for example, when recording a HPV vaccination when noted on a vaccination card)

concept.display: meningococcal oligosaccharide (groups A, C, Y and W-135) diphtheria toxoid conjugate vaccine (MCV4O)
Historical record of a typhus vaccination
Historical diphtheria and tetanus toxoids and acellular pertussis, poliovirus, Haemophilus b conjugate and hepatitis B (recombinant) vaccine.

property.valueString: This is not the same as CVX 146, Hexavalent vaccine.

This code is used whenever the actual formulation is not determined or when aggregating all Novel H1N1 Influenza-09 immunizations for reporting to CRA. It should not be used for seasonal influenza vaccine that is not otherwise specified. (NOS)

concept.display: Novel Influenza-H1N1-09, live virus for nasal administration
tetanus and diphtheria toxoids, not adsorbed, for adult use

property.valueString: Note that this Td is not adsorbed.
This CVX code allows reporting of a historic vaccination when the formulation is unknown (for example, when recording a Td vaccination when noted on a vaccination card)
IIV3. This vaccine code is one of two which replace CVX 15, influenza, split virus.
This CVX code allows reporting of a vaccination when formulation is unknown (for example, when recording a JE vaccination when noted on a vaccination card)
IIV3. This is one of two codes replacing CVX 15, which is being retired.

concept.display: Adenovirus, type 4 and type 7, live, oral

property.valueString: This vaccine is administered as 2 tablets.
IIV3

concept.display: respiratory syncytial virus monoclonal antibody (motavizumab), intramuscular
Diphtheria and Tetanus Toxoids and Acellular Pertussis Adsorbed, Inactivated Poliovirus, Haemophilus b Conjugate (Meningococcal Protein Conjugate), and Hepatitis B (Recombinant) Vaccine.

property.valueString: Note that this vaccine is different from CVX 132.

concept.display: Meningococcal, MCV4, unspecified conjugate formulation(groups A, C, Y and W-135)

property.valueString: This CVX should only be used for historical doses of meningococcal conjugate vaccine where the formulation is unknown (oligosaccharide vs polysaccharide). It is not the same as CVX 108, Meningococcal, unspecified formulation. This CVX is for unspecified Meningococcal conjugate vaccines.

concept.display: Meningococcal Groups C and Y and Haemophilus b Tetanus Toxoid Conjugate Vaccine

property.valueString: new in 2012.  LAIV4
New in 2012.  IIV4
This CVX should only be used for historical records where the formulation of nasal flu vaccine is not known.
This CVX should only be used for historical records where the formulation of pneumococcal conjugate vaccine is not known.

concept.display: Influenza, injectable, Madin Darby Canine Kidney, preservative free

property.valueString: ccIIV3
Do not use this code. This product may be used for Hep A and other viral infections. The correct vaccine / CVX is 86 (IG).

concept.display: Seasonal, trivalent, recombinant, injectable influenza vaccine, preservative free

property.valueString: RIV

property.valueString: This immune globulin may be administered either IM or IV.
This immune globulin may be administered IM only.
New in 2013.  IIV4

influenza, intradermal, quadrivalent, preservative free, injectable
meningococcal vaccine of unknown formulation and unknown serogroups

property.valueString: This CVX is intended for use when any one of the meningococcal vaccines is recorded and there is no information about which serogroups are protected against. This code should not be used when a newly administered immunization is recorded.

concept.display: Seasonal trivalent influenza vaccine, adjuvanted, preservative free

property.valueString: This vaccine is not available in the US.

concept.display: Non-US bivalent oral polio vaccine (types 1 and 3)

property.valueString: This is a non-US vaccine that may be seen in some immunization histories.

concept.display: Non-US monovalent oral polio vaccine, unspecified formulation

property.valueString: This is a non-US vaccine that may be seen in some immunization histories. It is composed of either Type 1, Type 2 or Type 3 oral polio vaccine.
This record duplicates CVX 13 (TIG). Do not use CVX 180.
This code represents an oral polio vaccine where the specific formulation is unknown.
This vaccine is stabilized with sorbitol and lactose and has been used outside the US for some time. It will be made available in the US.
